mods.note: Translation of letter No.398 dated the 25th July 1933, from the Residency Agent, Sharjah, to the Political Agent, Bahrain. After Compliments. Reference your letter No.150 dated the 21st May 1932 on the subject of the matter of the translated petition dated the 28th April 1933 from Maginmai LikufflG'&Sj on which you wanted me to report, I most respectfully beg to give below my report in this connection*- Tt Maginmai Likumuas had some dealings with a slave named Sultan Al Habshi who was a slave of Thani bin Khalaf of Dibai. The slave absconded to Muscat and was granted a manumission certificate from there. He then returned to Sharjah and showed me the manumission certificate. I assured him that nobody will interfere with his freedom. He went to Dibai and remained there. Since the slave in question is known to the Arabs ana the Banias and others and used to deal with pearls secretly, he made transaction with Maginmai Dikumuas and mortgaged to him a godo wn which is not his property but belongs to one poor ^uan of Dibai. Sultan remained in Dibai forsome months at Dihai. Then he left for Bahrain. The Bania complained about the mortgage over which a long discussion took place between mt; and tne Shaikh of Dibai« In the end I referred the matter to the Hon f bie the Political Resident(Colonel Pridaux who visited the Oman Coast accompanied oy Major Daly. As soon as they arrived, uie Bania mentioned his case to them. Thereupon investigations were made in their presence and it was proved that the mortgaged gouown did * not belong to Sultan AlHabsni. They uecibed the case against Sultan^ - Sultan is at present at Bahrain. He has been working in the Gfaaus since few years and ne is known at Bahrain too. This is the detail of the matter n .

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: ‘File B/10 IX Claim of Maginmal Likumdas of Dubai’

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 6; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains two letters written in both Arabic and English, in July 1933. The first letter is a report from the Residency Agent, Sharjah to the Political Agent, Bahrain about a claim of fraud made by Maginmal Likumdas (also spelt Lakamdas) of Dubai, against a former slave called Sultan Al Habshi, also of Dubai, which was investigated and upheld by the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf. This is followed by an acknowledgement letter from the Political Agent, Bahrain to the Residency Agent, Sharjah.
